pr_title: Load GoCD configurations from config repositories on GoCD startup.

timeline.message:
Initialize config repositories only after cruise-config.xml is initialized and plugin is loaded.

Implementation:

* Implement ConfigChangedListener and PluginChangeListener as part
  of ConfigRepositoryInitializer to listen to cruise-config.xml
  initialized and plugin loaded events

* Perform config repositories initialization only when all the
  in use config repository plugins are loaded.

* Make sure config repositories are initialized only once, even
  when multiple config change event is called or the config repo
  plugins are unloaded and loaded again.

Need:

Plugins are loaded in a separate thread as that of the application
initializer. Hence, there is possibility of race condition, where,
the config repository initializer is called before the cruise-config
is loaded, which possibly can cause config validation errors as
entities coming from config repository may depend on/refer to entities
from basic cruise-config.xml

timeline.bodyText: @GaneshSPatil with this check, in cases where multiple ConfigRepo plugins are used none of the repos will be parsed if a single plugin is missing. Guess this was not intended.
timeline.author: maheshp

replies.bodyText: @maheshp - yes, you're right. Will change this check to process the config repositories as and when plugins are laoded.
replies.author: GaneshSPatil

timeline.message:
Load GoCD configurations from config repositories on GoCD startup.

* Add a config repo plugin load listener to initialize the GoCD
  configuration from the existing config repo material repository
  from flyweight folder.

* Skip initializing config repositories which are not available
  under flyweight folder (which are not cloned by GoCD yet).

* Always return plugin post load hook result as success, even
  on config repo initialization failure due to errors (such as
  config validation / rules violations). As returning a failure
  response on plugin post load hook will mark plugin as invalid.

timeline.bodyText: @GaneshSPatil can we register for ConfigChange in the constructor over the intitalize method. If we register in the intialize method, the config repos will most likely be parsed as part of the main thread and this will lead to increased startup time for GoCD instances with larger configs and multiple config repos. WDYT?
timeline.author: maheshp

timeline.message:
Fix comments

* Move registering config change listener to constructor.
* Log an error when config repository parsing fails.
* Add a system property to initialize config repositories
  on startup.
  Based on the system property value, register the config
  change and plugin load listeners.
